timeline.body: Maybe default access modifier is more suitable here, instead of `public` as this method is only used within all classes in this package?

timeline.body:
Can be replaced with method reference
```suggestion
        String str = containers.stream().map(KieContainerResource::toString).collect(Collectors.joining("\n\t"));
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Can be replaced with method reference

Suggested change
String str = containers.stream().map(e -> e.toString()).collect(Collectors.joining("\n\t"));
String str = containers.stream().map(KieContainerResource::toString).collect(Collectors.joining("\n\t"));
timeline.author: afalhambra

timeline.body:
`installContainersSync` and `installContainers` methods are doing the same, with same parameters. I know it's already doing this way in some other classes, but just out of curiosity - this is only in case we wanted to separate some logic methods for doing it async/sync way? such as:

https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/master/kie-server-parent/kie-server-remote/kie-server-jms/src/main/java/org/kie/server/jms/ContainerManagerEJB.java#L38

(though it will call the `installContainersSync` method at the end)
timeline.bodyText:
installContainersSync and installContainers methods are doing the same, with same parameters. I know it's already doing this way in some other classes, but just out of curiosity - this is only in case we wanted to separate some logic methods for doing it async/sync way? such as:
https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/master/kie-server-parent/kie-server-remote/kie-server-jms/src/main/java/org/kie/server/jms/ContainerManagerEJB.java#L38
(though it will call the installContainersSync method at the end)
timeline.bodyHTML:
installContainersSync and installContainers methods are doing the same, with same parameters. I know it's already doing this way in some other classes, but just out of curiosity - this is only in case we wanted to separate some logic methods for doing it async/sync way? such as:

https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/master/kie-server-parent/kie-server-remote/kie-server-jms/src/main/java/org/kie/server/jms/ContainerManagerEJB.java#L38

(though it will call the installContainersSync method at the end)

timeline.body:
`outputDirectory` should be `readonly` otherwise, if this is modified, dependencies might not necessarily be packaged in the generated jar file afterwards in line:

https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/968e8d0e6183e2119d2ca5743c3ac942cd96e83b/kie-maven-plugin/src/main/java/org/kie/maven/plugin/PackageKjarDependenciesMojo.java#L168
timeline.bodyText:
outputDirectory should be readonly otherwise, if this is modified, dependencies might not necessarily be packaged in the generated jar file afterwards in line:

  
    
      droolsjbpm-integration/kie-maven-plugin/src/main/java/org/kie/maven/plugin/PackageKjarDependenciesMojo.java
    
    
         Line 168
      in
      968e8d0
    
    
    
    

        
          
           Files.copy(local, new File(outputFolder, local.getName()));
timeline.bodyHTML:
outputDirectory should be readonly otherwise, if this is modified, dependencies might not necessarily be packaged in the generated jar file afterwards in line:

droolsjbpm-integration/kie-maven-plugin/src/main/java/org/kie/maven/plugin/PackageKjarDependenciesMojo.java

Line 168 in 968e8d0

Files.copy(local, new File(outputFolder, local.getName()));
timeline.author: afalhambra

timeline.body:
maven build is packaging deps in `BOOT-INF/classes/KIE-INF/lib/`, having following folder structure inside the jar:

- BOO-INF
      - classes/KIE-INF/lib
- META-INF

would it make more sense to have a folder structure like instead:

- BOO-INF
- KIE-INF
- META-INF

Or why not just moving deps to the BOOT-INF/lib folder instead of creating a new folder structure? any potential issue with the classloader?

wdyt?
timeline.bodyText:
maven build is packaging deps in BOOT-INF/classes/KIE-INF/lib/, having following folder structure inside the jar:

BOO-INF
- classes/KIE-INF/lib
META-INF

would it make more sense to have a folder structure like instead:

BOO-INF
KIE-INF
META-INF

Or why not just moving deps to the BOOT-INF/lib folder instead of creating a new folder structure? any potential issue with the classloader?
wdyt?
timeline.bodyHTML:
maven build is packaging deps in BOOT-INF/classes/KIE-INF/lib/, having following folder structure inside the jar:

  • BOO-INF
    - classes/KIE-INF/lib
  • META-INF

would it make more sense to have a folder structure like instead:

  • BOO-INF
  • KIE-INF
  • META-INF

Or why not just moving deps to the BOOT-INF/lib folder instead of creating a new folder structure? any potential issue with the classloader?

wdyt?
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: I will check if it is possible to workaround spring boot plugin. don't commit to anything

If removed, we should remove dep from pom.xml:

https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-integration/blob/968e8d0e6183e2119d2ca5743c3ac942cd96e83b/kie-maven-plugin/pom.xml#L35-L38

and from pom.xml:

https://github.com/kiegroup/droolsjbpm-build-bootstrap/blob/f3a7669517d9ae0f0b3b3ace5983662c87f9982e/pom.xml#L3200-L3204
